availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard A. Darnell (Marion County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier.)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Charles Darnell and Mary Eliza Beauchamp Darnell. Attended school in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Marion County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a sergeant and private from September 17,1862, to May 22, 1865. Captured in Gallia County, Ohio, on July 20, 1863. Prisoner at Camp Chase, Franklin County, Ohio, from July 26, 1863, to August 20, 1863. Prisoner at Camp Douglas, Cook County, Illinois, from August 22, 1863, to March 2, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on May 22, 1865.

ab.bibl:
